title: He griped that no one cared about his prank call to Trump. Then, he said, the Secret Service knocked.
body: At first, John Melendez said the media wasn't paying enough attention to his stunt.

title: Women are uniting against sexual violence – and we won't be stopped | Purna Sen
body: Two in three women will experience sexual violence and harassment in their lifetime. Across the world, abusers have been put on noticeIn September 2015, states from across the world committed to end all forms of violence against women by 2030. Two years later we were saddened and angered by wave after wave of accounts of sexual harassment emerging initially from Hollywood but then from athletes, hotel workers, parliaments and elsewhere. Using the power of solidarity, and backed by the support of diligent and respectful journalists, women helped the world wake up to the daily horrors of sexual harassment and assault. Women live with the knowledge that hands can be shoved inside their clothing, they can be groped, grabbed by the genitals, targeted with sexual names or slurs, or raped. Women – as actual and potential targets of abuse – forego their freedom of movement and live with the ubiquitous fear of violence.  Continue reading...

title: Northern Territory 'should be test bed’ for Uluru statement proposals
body: As NT marks 40 years of self-government, former Labor MLA Ken Parish says the system has been problematicThe Northern Territory should become the “test bed” for reforms proposed in the Uluru statement and establish a formal Indigenous voice to Parliament, a former Labor parliamentarian and political analyst says.On Sunday, the Territory is marking 40 years of self-government. In Darwin and Alice Springs and many remote communities, locals will celebrate the same way they do every year, buying and exploding large amounts of fireworks during a day-long free-for-all. Continue reading...

title: Medicare spent $2 billion for one drug as the manufacturer paid doctors millions
Iowa Supreme Court Strikes Down Law Requiring Waiting Period for Abortion
body: The Iowa Supreme Court struck down a law that would require a three-day waiting period prior to obtaining an abortion in the state.

title: US 'not ready' for potentially deadly bug diseases
body: Experts warn programs to fight diseases caused by ticks, mosquitoes and other pests often aren't well-funded and aren't equipped to do proper surveillance or prevention.

title: Trump's dumbfounding bet on Scott Pruitt
body: It was the conclusion everyone saw coming — except President Trump.

title: Trade wars: More US tariffs expected on Chinese imports
body: Trump is refusing to back down on his decision to impose tariffs on billions of dollars in imports from trading partners.

title: Justin Trudeau on groping claims: 'I'm confident I did not act inappropriately' – video
body: The Canadian prime minister has spoken publicly for the first time about allegations made against him by a reporter.Justin Trudeau, who has been accused of groping the woman at a music festival in 2000, said: ‘I’ve been reflecting very carefully on what I remember from that incident almost 20 years ago. I do not feel that I acted inappropriately in any way’ Continue reading...

title: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif sentenced to 10 years over corruption
body: In landmark verdict, ex-PM and daughter Maryam sentenced to 10 and seven years in prison respectively over corruption.

title: Big Sugar bassist Gary Lowe dead at 65 after battle with cancer
body: Garry Lowe, bassist for the Canadian rock/reggae band Big Sugar, has died.

title: Renters would get longer tenancies under government plans
body: A minimum three-year contract would allow people to put down more roots in their area, ministers say.

title: The women paid to cry at the funerals of strangers
body: Professional mourners in Ghana are paid to attend the funerals of strangers.

title: Your pictures: Active
body: Each week, we publish a gallery of readers' pictures on a set theme. This week it is "active".

title: The Nigerian imam who saved Christians from Muslim gunmen
body: Villagers say the imam risked his life to shelter them, after they fled an attack by cattle herders.

title: Why female suicide in Afghanistan is so prevalent
body: In Afghanistan, an estimated 80% of suicide attempts are made by women. Why?

title: Good week, bad week: The people in the news
body: Who has had reason to be cheerful this week? And who can't wait for this week to be over?

title: 'Thousands of bees filled our garden'
body: A horrified couple describe the moment their Saturday morning was interrupted by thousands of bees.

title: The 103-year-old pianist

title: Tim Scott: Discussing race with Trump was 'painful' but made me 'hopeful'

title: Analysis: The 'civility debate' isn't about manners
body: Never question the resilience of the political class. Deep as we are now in the muck and guts of the Trump era, its dedication to managing appearances and propping up an obviously broken status quo endures.
